intro: Themistoclesia compta, commonly known as the small-leaved palaquium, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its simple, elliptical leaves that are often gland-dotted. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by capsules containing aromatic, sticky seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
